Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:He had an index card he had to return, so where did he put it after finding the book he needed? Choices:  A: inside the book B: oral report C: library D: fileing cabnet E: card catalogue<n><n>### Response:		E, card catalogue.<n><n>### Rational:<n><n>#### C<n><n>#A)<n><n>#B)<n><n><n>#A) He has no book to find to return index cards. <n><n>#B) He has found his book. <n><n>#C)He has put the index card inside the book and has brought with him to find the book.<n><n>#D)<n><n>#E)<n><n>#M) He has not had time to find the index card when he is told of a library.<n><n>#N) He has not had space enough on the library books to bring the index card.<n><n>#O) He has had to return the index card to find the book. <n><n>#### M<n><n>#A) <n><n>#B<n><n>#C<n><n>#D<n><n>#E<n><n>#N<n><n>#O<n><n>#E<n>C<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where do I put my coffee mug after it's dry? Choices:  A: shelf B: desktop C: cabinet D: kitchen E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>#### Response:Write an appropriate response that appropriately completing the request.<n><n>##### Input:Alannah, Beatrix and Queen prepare for the new school year by getting books from their parents.<n><n>### Inputs:3 friends prepared for the school year. Alannah has <20 more books> than Beatrix. Queen had <1/5> of all books. When Beatrix had <30 books>, how many books does that add to the total.<n><n>### Output:All together, they have <140> books. __________<n><n>### Problem:<n>The number of pages in a math book is 2 fewer than a book of social studies. If the number of pages in the two books together is 469, how many pages are in each book?<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident.  Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n><n>### Response:		John can go to the third floor of an apartment building by going to Detroit, up the stairs, or in a space shuttle.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>For John to get to the third-floor, he can take a detroit, elevator or space shuttle. However, Detroit will take longer than taking an elevator or stairs. Taking the elevator to get to the third floors saves a great amount of time. So, the answer is d.<n><n>#### bob8q<n>D:<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YMZDfSACZ6sYF0_iFo86DVqfK2K5YJgJZ_E5Y_-gxT4/edit?usp=sharing><n><n>#### bob11q<n>John does need to be in Detroit to travel to the 3rd floor of his apartment. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		<n>Demonstration:<n>Option A: Front door: Front door does not carry any mail.<n>Option B: Newspaper: It might carry the letters stolen, but there are many newspapers, so probably one or two.<n>Option C: Post office: It certainly carries the letter, but it might be more likely that the thief would know where it is.<n>Option D: Package: It carries only a letter; it might have gotten the wrong mail. It is also smaller than any other, being a package.<n>Option E: Mail box: It carries the wrong mail only if the thief was there and knew which mail box the thief was looking for.<n>

Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		A-School<n><n>### Rationale: School building is an office and its in New York.<n><n>### Input : Janet walks 1 block more than twice as far as Alicia. Alicia walks 3 blocks less than twice as far as Cody. How far is Cody from Janet?<n><n>### Response : 3<n><n>### Rationales : Since Janet walks 4 blocks more than twice as far Alicia.<n>Janet walks 2 blocks more than Alicia, 2 * 2 = <<2*2=4>>4.<n>From there Alicia walks for 3 blocks less than 4 which is 4-(3)(-1=2) blocks.<n>Sum of Alicia and Janet's walk is 4 + 2 = <<4+2=6>>6.<n>So Cody's distance from Janet is 6-3 = <<6-3=3>>3 blocks.<n><n>### Question: A man rode a bicycle at x km/hr, 1/3 the speed Pete walked. Two hours later, Pete biked at the same speed and traveled the same number of kilometers to the house as the man on a bike. How many kilometers did the man travel?<n><n>### Answer: 8 km<n><n>### Rason: When the man and Pete ride a bicycle the man travelled 2X km.<n>He travelled first 2X(x km/hr), it means he travelled 2 * x km = <<2*x=x>>x km.<n>And later on Pete rode the bicycle for 2km.<n>From it we can see that man travelled 2(x+x) km, since when two men travelled for 2Km.<n>So, man travelled 2xX km.<n>

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:James looked for a pencil sharpener.  Where might he look first? Choices:  A: cabinet B: library C: nightstand D: stationery store E: desk drawer<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>__Source:___<n><n>### Instructions:- Complete each sentence<n><n>- The 3/5 scale means that 3/5 points are possible <n>- The 9/10 of a pound scale means that 9/10 points are possible <n><n>### Input:-The 4/6 of a pound scale  means that___<n><n>### Response:-4/6 of a scale means that only __ points are possible<n><n>### Input<n>There was a fire. A building was lost completely. The other building was damaged completely. The fire department found a missing person. How many people were missing, in all?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Three people were missing in all.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.<n>#### <n>Answer: <n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriatelycompletes the request.<n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Lizards need the sun's heat to regulate their body temperature, this is why you'll see them still on what? Choices:  A: bushes B: dessert C: books D: heat lamps E: rocks<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: E<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: D<n><n>#### D<n>Answer: B<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: C<n><n>---<n>#### 1. <n>![Demonstration1](../assets/Demonstration1.jpg)<n>## Instruction:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Input: There are 35% fewer apples in 55 pies than pears. How many apples are in 75 pies?<n><n>Answer:<n>Input: If 12 students have an average score of 78 on a test, what was a mean of the students' original scores?<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>---<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where does a shadow usually appear? Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is the letter(s) in parenthesis.<n><n>#### C (surface of moon)<n>#### D (ground)<n><n>### Instructions: A. Complete the statements by changing the given fraction. B. Complete the statements by simplifying the given expression.<n><n>#### A<n>4/5 × 3/6 = <<4/5*3/6>> <-3/6=5/6>>5/6 = <-5/6=1/3>>1/3<n><n>#### B<n>42 ÷ 11 > 1/2<n>5/6 < 2/5<n><n>### Instructor:Ask your student to provide a response for each prompt.<n><n>#### 1. Solve for x: 3x-6<n><n>```C#<n>Console.WriteLine(3(x - 6));<n>```<n>Output: 9<n><n>#### 2. What is the value of -9?<n><n>```C# (x = -9)<n>Console.WriteLine(x);<n>```<n>Output: -9<n><n>#### 3. Do the following operations: 2 -1/3 -2/5<n><n>```C# 2 = 1<n>2-1/3-2/5-1-1/2=<-2/5+1/3-2+2*1/5-2-1>>2/5+1-9/5-1-2/3=<-9/5>><-9/5-7+1/5-10/5-1>><-21/5>><<21/5=4/5>>2/5*-1=<-2>><-2-<-9><n>Console.WriteLine(2 - 1/3 - 2/5);<n>```<n>Output:-2/5<n><n>#### 4. Do the following operations and simplify using the order of operations: 5 + (3 ÷ 2) + 8<n><n>```C#(5) | 3 ÷ 2 | 8<n>5+(3 ÷ 2)+8 = <-8+8+(3/2)> ==<-315>-25<n>Console.WriteLine(5 + (3 ± 2) + 4.9999 + 2/7);<n>```<n>Output -25
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:George ruined the surprise.  How did he do so? Choices:  A: hiding B: accidentally C: expectation D: knowingly E: planned<n><n>### Response:		A: hiding. B: accidentally. C: expectation. D: knowingly. E: planned.<n><n>### Input 1:There are 24 students in the class.  The teacher knows 4 of the students' names but cannot remember one. There are 8 students whose names she does not know and she can guess 3 students' names. How many students' names does she know?<n><n>### Response 1:The teacher must know 4 + 3 students' names, for a total of 7 students' names. There are 24 - 7 = <<24-7=17>>17 students whose names she does know.<n><n>###Input2:How many states border Alaska?<n><n>###Res 2:4 states: California, Washington, Idaho, British Columbia.<n><n>###Inst 3:Amy has 2/5 of the jelly beans in the box. How many jelly beans are there altogether?<n><n>### Res 3:2 jelly beans * (2/5) = <<2/5=0.4>>0.4 jelly beans * 5 jelly beans = <<5*0.4=2>>2 jelly beans<n>The total number of jelly beans is 2 + 2 + 5 = <<2+2+5=9>>9.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The circus monkey waived a white surrender flag, the conductor joked the monkey must work in the what? However, note that this will not change our outcome. When we subtract 2, we get 2449000000 and not 2

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where is the strategic gold reserve in the U.S.? Choices:  A: jewelery B: fort knox C: church D: jewelry store E: treasure chest<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the strategic gold reserve is in a church or a treasure chest, they are both jewelry stores.<n>The gold reserve is only at the fort knox or jewelry store.<n>The gold reserve not at the jewelry store or a treasure chests, so they should be at the treasure chests or at the jeweleries.<n>If at jewelery store, they would be the fort knox or a treasure chester.<n>If at a treasure chest or the fort knox, then they should be at a church.<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input<n>In a group of 6 girls, 1 has brown hair, 2 have blue hair, and 3 have brown. Every girl has a different number of brown hairs. If 24 hairs are brown, how many hairs did the group of 6 girls have altogether?<n>### Response<n>If there were 1 more brown haired girl than 24, then the group of 6 would have 24+1 = <<24+1=25>>26 brown hairs in total.<n>If there were 2 more than 24, than the group of 6 had 25+2 = <<25+2=27>>28 brown hairs in all.<n>If there were only 1 more brown haird girl than 24 brown haird girl, then the group of six would have 24 + 1 = 25 brown hairs.<n>If there were more than 1 brown haired girl than there were brown hairs, then it would have more than 24 more, and the group of 6 will had the 25 + x > 24 =<<x>24>>x brown hairs. <n>### Answer<n> If there were 1 more than the 24, then group of 6 would had 25 brown hair in total.<n> If there were more than 24 hairs, and more than 1 more than the brown haired girl, then each hair would have 2 less hair than it did. <n>#### 25<n>Answer: 25<n><n>### Input : Two of every creature filled Noah's ark for 40 days. How many animals were left on the ark?<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. Mary has two-fifths of the candy in Courtney’s collection. If Mary has 12 candies more than than Courtney, how many candies does Courtney own?<n><n>### Response<n>Courtney owns \(C = 3x12 = 36\) candies, since \(M = (2/5)*C = (2/5)\*36 \approx 15.2\) candies.<n><n><br><br><n><n>## Output<n><n>Input: Janet is younger than Sue. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If a person is seeing new things, what do they most often feel? Choices:  A: curiosity B: excitement C: boredom D: wonder E: fear<n><n>### Response:		<n>Curiosity<n><n>### rationale:<n>M-D-F-W-E, which begins with the letters of Monday, Dinner, Fear, Wonder, and End.<n><n>### Input : How many days are in August?  Choices: 1. 31 2. 30 3. 27 4. 31<n>```{->}<n><a href = "https://github.com/abzbhx">Blog</a><n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n>#### 1. 30<n><n>### r.<n><n>#### 2. 31 <n><n>#### 3. 28<n><n>#### 4.31<n><n>r. <n><n>```{->}Blog: https://github.com/alien-dev}<n>```<n>### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What part of the body are lips on? One of the friends then takes Pete’s chips, and the friend left with the most chips after Pete is John. How many chips were there at first?<n>Rationales After John takes Pete’s chip, there are 34 - 1 = <<34-1=33>>33 chips left in the game.<n>From 34 chips to John’s chip, which is the last chip, two people went out of the game. However, the number of chips that went out of the game was not 2, but 3. Therefore, there were 34 chips initially.<n>#### 34<n>Answer: 34<n>#### 34

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What does one chop us a grape for? Choices:  A: fresh fruit B: wine press C: fruit basket D: fruit cocktail E: picnic basket<n><n>### Response:		<n>Chose: A: fresh fruit<n><n><n>### Instructions:In a garden, a single seed yields between 5 and 20 tomato plants, a single watermelon seed yields 5 watermelons, and each carrot seed yields 6 carrots. How many carrot seeds should be planted so that the yield is at least 75 carrots?<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input: 56<n><n>Input: A single seed yields 5 tomato plants, a carrot seed yields 4 carrots, and each watermelon seed 2 watermelons. How many seeds are required to make yields at least 45 plants and 80 pounds?<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input<n>A single seed yields 5 watmelon plants<n> 5 > 1 > 5  <<n><n>Input: <n><n>#### 21<n>Answer: 64<n><n>Input: 72<n><n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Follow the model for identifying the correct answer and write a complete set of steps to solve the problem.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Input<n><n>- In a classroom of 200 students, 25 percent have been vaccinated for the measles. What percentage of the students have not been vaccinated?<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>- What is the percentage of students that have been vaccinates<n>- 25%<n>- What is the rest of the students?<n>- Not been vaccinates.<n>- Total students that need to be added to the previous statement to find the percentage of not vaccinated<n><n>### Example<n>- A farmer has 30 head of cattle. One-third of the cattle are male, and 2/5 of the males are pregnant. How many of the farmer's cattle are male?<n><n>### How the student response relates to the original instructions<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Step 1:<n><n>### Step2:<n><n>### Answer:<n>- A: 6<n>- B: 18<n>- C: 21<n>- D: 24<n>- E: 42<n>- F: 6<n><n>### Step3:<n><n>### B: 30<n>- What is the total amount of cattle? 30 head of cattel<n>- 1/3 cattel are male.<n>- 2/5 cattel that are male are pregnant<n>- 1/5 female are pregnant<n>How many male cattel that are not pregnant.<n>2/5 -1/5 = <<2/5-1/5=1/5>>1/5 of male cattel that are pregnant.<n><n>### Step4:<n>- Total male cattel that are non pregnent<n><n>total head of cattel-30<n><n>30 - 1/5 non-pregnant male cattel<n><n>non-pregnant male catle (30-1/5) 28<n><n>2/4 male catel<n><n>7<n><n>### Step5:<n>- A farmer that has 30 head cattel, 25% are pregnant
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is a useful activity when experiencing loneliness? Choices:  A: meet people B: meet friend C: make people laugh D: socialize E: liquor<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: To combat loneliness, people should meet people instead of making people laugh. The problem with meeting people is it is harder to meet one person since having more people to meet increases the chances of getting to know people better.<n><n>#### C<n> Answer: C

Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What eastern state is home to a mountain? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		C: picture<n><n>### Inputs:A: how many points was the joker's score after 5 rounds?<n>B: he received 9 points for each correct answer<n><n>C: the grand master scored 600 points<n><n>### Rationale:A: The joker had 5 points after the first round.<n>Five rounds later, she had 5*5=<<5*5=25>>245 points total.<n>B: The joker would have scored 9 points after the first round if she had answered the question correctly.<n>The questions the joker answered correctly were worth 50 points each plus 45 points for each correct bonus question she answered, so she earned 50 + 45 =<<50+45=95>>95 points<n><n>After her first bonus question was worth 30 points, and the rest were worth 25 each.<n>So, she scored 70 points in all.<n>C: Grand master would have scored 60 points after two rounds if he had answered the first question correctly.<n>The joker gave grand master the correct answer.<n>After two rounds, he had 60 + 45 + 45 + (95 - 70) + (95 - grand master's true score) =<<60+45+45+(95-70)+(95-gtmscore)=400>>400 points, 27 bonus question were worth 25 points each, and 95 of his points were from his correct answers and bonus questions.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If I need deodorant, where do I go to but some? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write down the letter that comes next.<n>#### B<n>Answer:<n><n>----<n><n>### Source:<n>Exercises<n><n>----<n><n>#### Reference<n>[10.1: Reading Test Items](//www.cbstestprep.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/10.1-Reading-Test-Items.pdf)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Who sits at the center table at a receeption? Choices:  E: restaurant D: corridor B: wedding party A: restorant E: restaurant is the center table at a reception<n>Rationales: E is the only center table in the choices given<n>####  A<n>Answer:  A<n><n><n>### Input-Answer 2<n>#### Input: How many cents are in 3,350,840 dollars?<n>#### Answer: 3437920350<n><n>### Demo:<n>#### Input: John walks 4,000 steps in one day. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n><n>### Response:		He doesn't have any money left for bankruptcy.<n><n>### Rationale: His testicles have been swollen because he cannot use them.<n><n>### Correct response:<n><n>**Solution B:** Diane lost one pound a week last week. If she continues on this diet pattern, she will weigh exactly 3 pounds less than she weighed a week ago in 4 weeks. To maintain her weight, she needs to lose or gain exactly 3 lbs. per week. Is her diet pattern effective?<n><n>### Explanatory:<n><n>After the first week, her diet pattern has 1 pound less weight. That means, she needs to maintain her 0.5 pounds weight. In 4 weeks, she has to gain and lose exactly 3 pounds. If weight loss per week doesn't exceed 2 pounds, she will be 3 pounds lighter.<n><n>### Solutions:<n><n>If she maintains her 0.5 weight every week, her weight after 4 weeks will be 1.25pounds more than her current weight.<n><n>The weight after 4 weeks is = 1.25/0.5 = 2.5.<n><n>The weight on that day is 11pounds more than what she is currently holding.<n><n>$$\therefore$$<n><n>After 4 weeks, she weighs 11/2.5-1pounds less than what she had 4 weeks ago.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>**Solutions A:** A rectangular area measures at least 12,000 square feet and is 100 feet long and less than the square of 400 feet.<n><n>**Solution C:** 56 feet long and 400 feet wide, at least 46,000 square foot.<n><n>**Correct solution:** 56 by 400 feet long and at least 46.000 feet around.<n><n>### A. A rectangular area measures 12,0 000 square feet, has a diagonal of 400 ft, and is at least 400 ft on a side?<n><n>Yes.<n>$$\therefore$$, area = 12000 square feet<n>$$\therefore

Choices:  A: edge B: desire to win C: friendship D: rivalry E: skill<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>Answer: E<n><n>Input: The teacher has a classroom of 21 students. The ratio of boys to girls is 5 to 4. How many students are in her class?<n>Rationales:: The number of girls:5+4*4+4=<<5+4*4=16>>16<n>The number of boys:5+4+(4+4)*4+4=<<4+5>>5<n>The total number of students in the class is 16+5 = <<16+5=21>>21 students since the sum of the numerator in each ratio does not equal the sum of the denominator in each ratio.<n>#### 24<n>Answer: 24*4+5*4*4=19<n><n>#### 24+9<n>Answer: 33<n><n>### Instructions<n>Input: A boy and girl have a party together. The ratio of boys and girls is 3 to 2. If there are 5 times as many guests as there were boys, how many guests attended the party?<n>Rationales : The number of boys and girls is <<3+2>>3+2<n>The ratio of boys = <<3+2>>/<<3>>=2<n>The ratio of guests = <<5+0>>/<<2>>=25<n>The total number or guests = <<3*4>>/<<3+2>>=1*2 = <<1*2=2>>2<n><n>##################################################################################################<n>

Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: The beach and the surface of the Earth together cover<n>3/4 of what is covered by the ocean.<n>Therefore, The beach and the surface<n>of the Earth cover 9/2 in all.<n><n>### 72 * 9/2 * 7/4<n>= [([(72 + (72*9)/2)/4]<n>= [([(3592)/16]<n>= [([3592/16]/4]<n>= [9.<n><n>### [72/4]<n><n>### [([72 + (7 2*9)/2]/4]<n>=  [ 72/4  * 1/2]<n>=  [72/8]<n>= [36/2]<n>=  18<n><n>### [((((72 + (3592)/2)/4](<n><n>### [ ]<n><n>### [ 50/8]<n>=  [50/4]<n>= [12.5 ]<n><n>### 12.5 * 9/4 * 7/2<n><n>### 9.<n><n>##### Input:Three times as many as John is as Melissa are covered by the ocean. Melissa has how many more books than Mary? Choices: A: 1 more B: 2 more C: 3 more D: 4 more E: 5 more<n><n>### ResponseD<n><n>### Demos:<n>input: Melissa has 3 times as many books as is John is as Melissa is Melissa. However, Mary has 1 more than Melissa does.<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>### Melissa has 3 *6 + 1<n>Mary has 6 + 1<n><n>### [3*6+1]<n><n>### 3*6<n><n>### 5<n><n>### *1<n><n>### 6<n><n>### +1<n><n>### So, Mary has 13 books more than Melissa has.<n><n>#### 13<n><n>### Rewriting Answer:Mary has 3 times as much as Melissa does. However, 1 time as Mary as John is as Mel
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:When people want to watch a new move, the often go see it at the? Choices:  A: town B: conference C: bathroom D: theater E: train station<n><n>### Response:		When people want to watch a movie they can go to the cinema. <n>Cinema or a movie theater is a venue which shows a movie to an audience for a profit.<n>The cinema started with the invention of the film in the late 1880s and early 1890s.<n><n>#### Cinema or a Movie Theater<n><n>Answer: Cinema or a movie theater<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents.
